title: How to remove malicious OS build on Samsung Galaxy S24?
content:
How do I remove malicious OS build on Samsung Galaxy S24?

Phone won't let me remove malicious software and all scans from multiple sources get directed to emulated files. Factory reset reinstalled all lib files on gradle and restricts opening any software or tools I could use to fix this problem.

What should I do?

Software information

One UI version 6.1

Android version 14

Google Play system update August 1, 2024

Baseband version S928USQU3AXH7

Kernel version 6.1.57-android14-11-29543898-abS928USQU3AXH7 #1 Fri Aug 16 08:31:05 UTC 2024

Build number UP1A.231005.007.S928USQU3AXH7

SE for Android status Enforcing SEPF_SM-S928U_14_0001 Fri Aug 16 17:48:02 2024

Knox version Knox 3.10 Knox API level 37 Knox ML 1.4 DualDAR 1.6.0 HDM 2.0 - 1D

Service provider software version SAOMC_SM-S928U_OYN_TMB_14 0026 TMB/TMB,TMB/XAU/TMB

Carrier configuration version 4.0000

Security software version MDF v3.3 Release 1 BT v1.0 Release 1 WLAN v1.0 Release 2 VPN Client v2.4 Release 2.0 ASKS v8.1 Release 20230714 ADP v3.1 Release 20230510 FIPS BoringSSL v1.7 FIPS SKC v2.3 FIPS SCrypto v2.7 SMR Aug-2024 Release 1

Android security patch level August 1, 2024

GPU Version OpenGL ES 3.2 [email protected] (GIT@d774a8672e, 18ea610b5b4, 1704277645)

comments.text: Why do you think your OS is malicious? By default the bootloader is locked and verified boot is active which means the system partition is signed and can not be modified.
I’m voting to close this question because it is not about reverse engineering.  It's more like technical support.
